lenders.occupational_info: I work for Slooh.com - a live astronomical observatory. We connect telescopes to the internet and provide live views of space to members in over 70 countries.

lenders.name: Prof. Dr.
lenders.loan_because: The only way for people (and families, villages, and countries) to survive and increase their standard of living is to have access to and build upon capital. The NY Times bestselling book The End of Poverty by Jeffrey Sachs is must reading for everyone who is interested in Kiva, microlending, or helping others in the "third world." Kiva members: please be aware that only supporting microfinance as the sole solution for ending extreme poverty is wrong. Without extended directed humanitarian relief (such as health care, food, etc) and foreign support for public investment (in health care, education, family planning, infrastructure, administration, etc) microlending can only have limited effectiveness and the poverty trap CANNOT BE BROKEN. Urge your elected officials to actually fund the commitments that the US and many other countries have made to the Millenium Development Goals (MDG)! See: http://devdata.worldbank.org/atlas-mdg/ for MDG data. Hans Rosling on development (AV presentations): http://www.ted.com/index.php/talks/view/id/92 http://www.ted.com/index.php/talks/view/id/140 Jeffrey Sachs (audio lectures): http://www.bbc.co.uk/radio4/reith2007/ There are opportunities and dilemmas in providing access to capital. In many situations, providing capital (tools and opportunities) can be wonderful; in other situations counterproductive. For example, providing loans for someone to sell an imported good that is unhealthy for the local population and environmentally unsound is ethically troublesome (cigarettes are the perfect example). I hope Kiva and its partners will acknowledge, learn about, and discuss these issues and not try to ignore them. Microlending is in its early stages and still needs research and development to further its helpfulness and sophistication. Funding individuals and organizations through Kiva helps establish the cycle that allows everyone (lenders, lending intermediaries, and borrowers) to learn, build, and learn again to find the right methods and opportunities to create healthful and sustainable change. "Capital as such is not evil; it is its wrong use that is evil. Capital in some form or other will always be needed." Mahatma Gandhi
lenders.occupational_info:
--teaching the next generation
--researching to increase our knowledge

lenders.name: Teri
lenders.loan_because: I do a lot of volunteer work with disadvantaged families here in Phoenix, and this gives me a chance to do something on a more "global" scale--but still within my own means! What a great concept. I am presently reading "Banker to the Poor" by Muhammad Yunus, Founder of Grameen Bank; if you want a true inspiration, read this book!!
lenders.occupational_info: I write stories for the local, community newspaper. It is free to the people who live in the community, and comes out once a month.

I loan because God loves me. I loan because it pleases God, the creator of all things, the one true God, who sent His only son to die for my sins. It is with great gratitude and thankfulness that I do the will of God according to the Bible; HIS word alone. 

1 John 3:17 
James 2:15-16
Deut 15:7
Deut 15:11
Matthew 19:21 
Matthew 25:35 
Luke 12:33 
Luke 18:22 
And about 100 other passages from my King James Bible.

I write and deliver training to staff at Prison Fellowship Ministries. PFM is a Christian company which encourages churches to go into prisons and preach the gospel, encourage the people in there and help anyone that wants it, a way to stay out of prison once released.

When I'm not there, I am a writer, African storyteller and artist. In the picture above I am telling African stories to second graders in a primary school. Being a professional storyteller means I get paid to tell tales. I do this for schools, churches, libraries, museums and companies.

lenders.occupational_info: Paying It Forward Funding (PIFF) is a Not-for-profit FREE Crowdfunding service to generate loans for KIVA. Whilst other sites charge fundraisers up to 10% or more, NO fees will be charged by us !

lenders.name: Steve
lenders.loan_because: Loaning through Kiva really highlights what helping others is about.  Anyone can give random people $25-50 and go on with life having the "I did something nice" feeling, but loaning through Kiva goes deeper than that; it is a chance to learn about how others live throughout the world and potentially make a friend.  10 years ago, a person would need to take time off work and a trip around the world to experience what Kiva offers to both the recipient and lender.

We all need friends to help us out from time to time.

lenders.name: Denise
lenders.loan_because: We are all one, a beautiful tapestry of hearts and souls, and we must help one another be the best we can be while on our planet.
lenders.occupational_info: I work to help others respect, value and treat one another with dignity by opening up dialogue about intercultural nuances and how to resolve interpersonal and community conflict  so as to create a more  connected, peaceful world.

lenders.occupational_info: I am a psychology professor.

lenders.name: Laura
lenders.loan_because: I'm a quarter Ukranian, so want to lend there.   Im a neighbor to Mexico, so want to lend there.

lenders.name: piyush
lenders.loan_because:
My name is PIYUSH BANERJEA. I am from India I am writting this to u all. pls read it.
I am  a simple person from India. Use to have a small leather business. I was happy in my own world. Was working with all honesty.Suddenly one day I got in touch with a person on net. He posed to be an importer of leather goods. He showed very keen interest in my Products. He was very professional. In two, three days intraction he asked me for sample. He was unknown to me. i tried to be smart and asked for advance. Without any hagitation he agreed. he gave me international postal money orders. he used some american address .I deposited the postal money orders to my  bank. In due course the bank cleared the money orders. It gave me strength to beleive him. I gave him the samples. later on he gave me bulk order for my goods and paid the amount by postal money orders. again the same procedure. i submitted-bank cleared it. but in the mean time he did one tricky thing. he increased the order . he gave me money in advance so i didn't have single doubt on him. I manufactured the goods from my own pocket. I was very happy . i was doing good. I shipped the goods to him. Then i started asking him for the balance payment but to my utter surprise he stopped receiving my call and not even gave any response to my emails.and suddenly after few time bank personal turned up to my place and asked me to return the money and the reason they gave me to do so was that the postal money order which i got from that person turned to be fake.. by knowing this earth slipped beneath my feets. I was in complete dark. bank  started legal action against me. later on I came to know that the person who gave me the postal money order was a Nigerian. i am totally ruined. Didn't have enough money to give a normal life to my wife and two kids.i am bound to repay the bank otherwise they will put me behind bars. Yes I am victim of NIGERIAN SCAMMERS. I am writting all this beacuse I need ur valuable support. I know life is not so easy. But for my fault my family members are not suppose to live like this.Money is very important for everyone. I just need little support from u all so that i can repay the bank. i don't have much time. You must be thinking that this is a new way to earn money but this is not true in this case.So i request u and all ur friends  for the sake of humanity pls help me .If u think that i am right then pls donate any amount to the below mentioned paypal id.your small help will do alot to my family.
 I am really very sorry for troubling u all. PLS trust me I am in need and thats why i am asking for help from u all. I know i am iritating u all. I don't have any other option but to ask for help from u all. I am not asking for big donation. just give me 300-500US$. I am begging to u all. this will help me to repay my debts and re-establish myself. I have no right to ask for money from u all but i don't have any other option. Just help this poor brahmin.

abhishal.s@rediffmail.com
this is my friend paypal id.

I decrease fighting in families.
I help individuals feel better about themselves.

See my Website for the art work I do

lenders.name: Stephen
lenders.loan_because: World Bank and IMF loans do not meet the needs of world citizens.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a documentary filmmaker and scholar living and working in the United States.

lenders.name: J Thomas
lenders.loan_because: Microfinancing is such a marvelous idea. Our family has supported the Grameen bank for many years; Kiva is a way for us to reach out on a more "person to person" level.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a heart specialist who treats heart failure

lenders.name: Stu
lenders.loan_because: I now have an opportunity to "Think Locally, Act Globally"
lenders.occupational_info: I'm a commercial seaplane pilot in the Seattle area.  When I'm not flying, I conduct geographic data analysis for environmental organizations.  Stray cats seem to find comfort in my arms.

lenders.name: Joy
lenders.loan_because: I'm an avid traveler, and this is a wonderful way to stay connected to the people and places that have touched me.
lenders.occupational_info: I used to write and help develop other writers for a living. Now I write for fun.

lenders.name: retrojayne
lenders.loan_because: I like the idea of donating personally to a distinct individual or small group. That way I know the money gets to them straightaway. Kind of like Sally Struthers' commercials, but without the scariness of Sally Struthers.

lenders.name: Matt
lenders.loan_because: I enjoyed Muhammad Yunus' Nobel Prize acceptance speech and wanted to help encourage his ideas.

lenders.name: Molly
lenders.loan_because: I have met the most lovely people in the world in rural Guatemala.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a mother over all else, but I am also starting a company that makes tote bags, so we will no longer need disposable ones.

lenders.name: Pradyumna
lenders.loan_because: No better way to fight poverty than to help people help themselves. =)

lenders.name: Mai
lenders.loan_because: I want to support my brothers and sisters around the world.
lenders.occupational_info:
I think the supreme aim of human life is working to create a more humane society. 

Act so as to elicit the best in others, and thereby in yourself.  ~Felix Adler~

lenders.name: Jerry
lenders.loan_because: I recognize that a small investment can have a global impact.
lenders.occupational_info: I am an advocate and educator on alternative energy; specializing at the moment in small scale biodiesel production.  Using locally available materials and vegetable oil biodiesel can be made for significantly less money than  the comparable amount of petroleum diesel.  It is sustainable and renewable.

lenders.name: Steven
lenders.loan_because: I am told to...
lenders.occupational_info: I help companies install and maintain their computer networks

lenders.name: Jordan
lenders.loan_because: I believe in investing in people.

lenders.name: Cory
lenders.loan_because: I can. I have been very blessed in my life and I want others to be able to realize their dreams. In many countries people cannot depend on their government to protect their well being. These stories are about people surviving and hopefully thriving in their communities, by doing it on their own. The best kind of giving is when you can see the change your donation can make.
lenders.occupational_info: I am the Executive Director of GreenLink. An alliance committed to promoting energy efficiency and conservation and the technologies that support energy reduction in homes and businesses.  I am also a part time doctoral student at George Mason University where I am studying Environmental Policy. I live in the beautiful Shenandoah Valley with my amazing husband Mike and our two dogs. We enjoy getting outside and exploring...hiking, fishing and golfing (poorly).

lenders.name: Nancita
lenders.loan_because: it's easy, sensible and so interesting.

lenders.name: hanavcbc
lenders.occupation: mortgage broker, mortgage rate calculator, mortgage calculator, best mortgage rate

lenders.name: Layfayette
lenders.loan_because:
We make a living by what we get, we make a life by what we give. 
-Sir Winston Churchill-

lenders.name: Gene
lenders.loan_because: My daughter sent me a gift certificate for my birthday!

lenders.name: Ravi Boddapati
lenders.loan_because: I would like to help those who are ready to help themselves and their communities

lenders.name: Wade
lenders.loan_because: It makes a big difference to those trying to improve their situations in life.

lenders.name: Toby
lenders.loan_because: I make a difference in peoples lives by helping them to create their own income.

lenders.name: Emily
lenders.loan_because: "The door to happiness opens outward."  Kierkegaard

lenders.name: James Omdahl
lenders.loan_because: It is the least I can do.
lenders.occupational_info: Online marketer, blogger and Kiva fan :)

lenders.name: Jackie
lenders.loan_because: A way to give back while encouraging growth in the global economy.
lenders.occupational_info: I manage all types of projects/programs and support the "People, Service, Profit" philosophy.

lenders.name: Calvin
lenders.loan_because: I believe in free enterprise.
lenders.occupational_info: I am studying at American University in Washington, DC. I study the world; I learn about history, culture, business, politics, and economics.

lenders.name: Jerry
lenders.loan_because: I want to give others the opportunity to achieve satisfaction and happiness via self-sufficiency.  It's a good feeling knowing that you're helping others to help themselves.
lenders.occupational_info: I am retired, after more than 32 years of working for the government.

lenders.name: Rodney
lenders.loan_because: So few have so much and so many more have so little. Everyone deserves a chance, if they want it. Why not loan?
lenders.occupational_info: I help report and analyze other people's money.

lenders.name: David
lenders.loan_because: I'm a business owner and understand the value of a good loan.
lenders.occupational_info: I deal with the transportation and installation for some of the most expensive art in the world.

lenders.name: Slane
lenders.loan_because: It's a good idea.
lenders.occupational_info: I help create websites for Disney DVDs.

lenders.name: Tommy
lenders.loan_because: I have a good life. I want to help someone else have the same.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a Conductor for a Major Passenger Railroad. I help move several thousand people a day.

lenders.name: Robert
lenders.loan_because: I was given a wonderful opportunity 14 years ago and bilieve in sharing.
lenders.occupational_info: I help clients with their investment, insurance and financial planning.

lenders.name: Overbrook Educational
lenders.loan_because: We, the sixth graders at OEC, a Philadelphia public school, loan because we want to see how we can have an impact upon people around the world.
lenders.occupational_info:
We are young people who care. The picture is of us in the letters "O", "E", and "C" -- a short cut for our school name.

Peace and love.

lenders.name: Mike Hinton
lenders.loan_because: There is no better way to invest in the prosperity of the whole world.
lenders.occupational_info: I do Physics research at a school in Ohio.  We experiment to find new science.

lenders.name: Christy
lenders.loan_because: I can.
lenders.occupational_info: I work for a company that publishes children's educational materials.

lenders.name: Fabian
lenders.loan_because: I believe that people are hard workers and that they need someone to believe in them in order to grow.
lenders.occupational_info: We give microcredits to finance house improvements and complete houses in poor areas in Mexico.

lenders.name: David
lenders.loan_because: I can and I believe in people

lenders.name: Samantha Mendes Da Costa
lenders.loan_because: I want to see how people can make a business thrive from a few simple loans. I admire these people for the work they do.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a Senior in College at Middle Tennessee State University. I am a Psychology major and a French and Mental Health Services minor.

lenders.name: Catherine
lenders.loan_because: I care about the economic health of the people of countries that the U.S. continues to take advantage of. We the people of the U.S. have to make it right.

lenders.name: Kirsten&Ben
lenders.loan_because: There is more happiness is giving.

lenders.name: Scott and Cindy
lenders.loan_because: We have been very blessed in our lives and would like to help others to improve their lives.

lenders.name: Troy & Becky
lenders.loan_because: We believe we're blessed so that we can be a blessing to others! If not us, then who? If not now, when? Get involved with Kiva. It's a great thing!

lenders.name: Ethan
lenders.loan_because: I was given a gift certificate for my birthday to Kiva.  I think it is kinda cool to be able to loan money to someone across the world!

lenders.name: NewLeaf Chocolates
lenders.loan_because: It makes us feel good.  Also, people should be rewarded for taking the initiative to improve their lives.  If people are living in a sustainable economy and have their basic needs met, they are more likely to live peaceful lives.
lenders.occupational_info:
NewLeaf Chocolates is an online shop that provides the world's best premium chocolates in a sustainable way. We continuously affirm our commitment to the planet in these tangible ways: 
1) Offering a wide selection of organic and fair-trade bars, confections and drinking chocolate,
2) Shipping all chocolate in our sustainable GreenPod that uses only plant-based materials and
3) Donating a portion of all sales to environmental charity.
Visit our website at: www.newleafchocolates.com

lenders.name: Mzurie
lenders.loan_because: it transforms my good intentions into action.
lenders.occupational_info: I write Living Rootless, a blog about travel and about living a portable life.

lenders.name: Irene
lenders.loan_because: it's a very simple and effective way to help.

lenders.name: LA & Alli
lenders.loan_because: We want help the people who strive to improve their own lives and those of the people around them.
lenders.occupational_info: Work to reconstruct and improve aquatic and terrestrial habitat for the benefit of wildlife and people.

lenders.name: Lillian
lenders.loan_because:
I believe in the power of a hand up over a hand out. 
I don't have a lot of money to continually donate.

lenders.name: Anna
lenders.loan_because: I am impressed with people that have such a drive to accomplish their dreams despite their circumstances, and, besides, I have more than enough to share and have no reason not to do so.
lenders.occupational_info: I am studying biochemistry currently, with hopes of eventually becoming a doctor.

lenders.name: wilfredo
lenders.loan_because: I want to lend money because desire to develop a project based on the manufacture of musical instruments with recycled materials and to be able to take it to the children of low resources in my pais solicito $3000 us
lenders.occupational_info: it is a project by which desire that the low children of resource motivate themselves, so that they develop musical skills and they are concienticen as well that we must reuse materials that we rejected every day

lenders.loan_because: I enjoy seeing other people succeed.
lenders.occupational_info: I teach people how to use computers.

lenders.name: Jim
lenders.loan_because: somebody else may need the money more than I

lenders.name: Chris
lenders.loan_because: Small businesses are the thread that holds the world economy together. As an entrepeneur myself, I definitely understand the importance of working capital and cash flow.
lenders.occupational_info: My company creates software that helps large high-tech organizations manage and optimize their tangible assets - equipment, tools, computers, vehicles, etc. in order to increase profits and also comply with all applicable regulations.

lenders.name: José
lenders.loan_because: I think it is very important to help others support themselves and their families.

lenders.name: David
lenders.loan_because: I care about you.
lenders.occupational_info: To educate North Americans that they are not the only people in our world.
